alert.note: Alert for Costilla; Huerfano (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 04 at 2:24PM MDT until August 04 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Spring Burn Scar in... Northeastern Costilla County in south central Colorado... West Central Huerfano County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 530 PM MDT. * At 224 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Spring Burn Scar. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the warning area will cause mud slides near steep terrain. The mud slide can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Spring Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Spring Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Spring Burn Scar north of Highway 160, northeastern Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Costilla county, Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Huerfano county, Indian Creek on the southeastern Spring Burn Scar and La Veta Pass. This includes the following high risk locations... South Abeyta Creek near County Road 443, South Abeyta Creek near County Road 442, South Abeyta Creek near County Road 441 and Pass Creek Road. This includes the following streams and drainages... Wagon Creek, Yellowstone Creek, Middle Creek, North abeyta Creek, South Abeyta Creek, Spring Branch, South Oak Creek, Sangre de Cristo Creek, Pass Creek, Palo Duro Creek, Oak Creek, North Middle Creek, South Middle Creek, Martin Creek and Missouri Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Spring Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
